name: Not repotting
description: Not repotting a plant as it ages or grows bigger can be a big mistake. Soil ages poorly because it erodes over time. Water can also impact the soil's quality.
consequence: Stunted plant growth and poor health due to degraded soil quality

name: Overwatering
description: Providing too much water to plants can lead to root rot and fungal growth. Many plants, especially succulents, prefer infrequent watering.
consequence: Root damage, yellowing leaves, or plant death due to excessive moisture

name: Insufficient light
description: Placing plants in areas with inadequate light prevents photosynthesis, causing weak growth or leggy stems.
consequence: Stunted plant growth, pale leaves, or elongated stems seeking light

name: Ignoring pests
description: Failing to check for or treat pests like spider mites or aphids can allow infestations to spread and harm plants.
consequence: Damaged leaves, weakened plants, or transmission of pests to other plants

name: Improper soil choice
description: Using the wrong soil type for a plant, such as heavy soil for succulents or poor-draining soil for moisture-sensitive plants, can hinder growth.
consequence: Poor root development, waterlogging, or nutrient deficiencies
